edu.cmu.cs.ark.sage

Class SAGE

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.cs.ark.sage.SAGE

  • public class SAGE
extends Object
    Main entry point to use SAGE. This class implements the functions needed to perform M-step optimization with SAGE word vectors. See source code of SupervisedSAGE for an example of how to use SAGE.

    Concepts

    • Effect refers to individual SAGE eta vectors, i.e there are one effect per eta vector. Effects can be described in several manners. The most common ones are NamedEffect and fixed Effect. See Effect and its subclasses for a list of available effect types. Effect also store the associated L1 and L2 regularization weights.
    • Each document is described by a set of Effects, known as EffectSet. There can be any number of EffectSets containing any combination of Effects. When optimizing for each Effect, words "generated" by EffectSet containing the Effect will be counted.
    • Feature describes the "feature" types of a document. Most of the time, these are simply UnigramFeature.

    Using SAGE consists of several steps:

    1. Set up You first set up the types of Effects, Features and EffectSets that SAGE will be dealing with when you load your documents. Each document will have its own EffectSet (probably not unique), and every word will probably belong to a UnigramFeature. You add Effects using addEffect(Effect), Features using addFeature(Feature) and EffectSets using addEffectSet(EffectSet).
    2. Initialization After loading required Effects, Features and EffectSets, we are ready to initialize() the system. This step will create and instantiate the eta vectors necessary for optimization. After this point, you can no longer add new Effects, Features or EffectSets. However, you can still change feature counts and effect regularization weights.
    3. Optimization Depending on whether there are latent variables, you adjust your feature counts accordingly by EffectSets, not by documents. This is because SAGE does not store the document structure, it instead treats each EffectSet as kind of a "document". You update feature counts using incrementFeatureCount(EffectSet, Feature, double) and incrementFeatureVector(EffectSet, FeatureVector) family of methods. After counts are updated, you call prepareOptimization() and then optimizeAll(boolean)/optimizeEta(Effect) to start optimization.

    References

    • Eisenstein, Jacob, Amr Ahmed, and Eric P. Xing. "Sparse additive generative models of text." In Proceedings of ICML. pp. 1041-1048. 2011. [PDF]
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Yanchuan Sim

      • initialize

        public void initialize(boolean randomInit)
        This step will create and instantiate the eta vectors necessary for optimization.
        Parameters:
        randomInit - Set true to randomly initialize the eta vectors.
        See Also:
        SAGE

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the SAGE object (with random initialization).
        See Also:
        initialize(boolean)

      • prepareOptimization

        public void prepareOptimization()
        This step is to be run before every round of optimization. It basically sets up the feature sums and caches necessary data to improve efficiency.

      • computeLogLikelihood

        public double computeLogLikelihood()
        Returns the log-likelihood of observing given features with current eta vectors (includes the regularization penalty).
        Returns:
        the log-likelihood of observing given features with current eta vectors.

      • computeEtaProbabilities

        public void computeEtaProbabilities()
        Compute feature probabilities for each effect set. Call after every round of optimization to update these values or featureProbability(EffectSet, Feature) family of methods would return state results.

      • optimizeAll

        public void optimizeAll(boolean randomOrder)
        Optimize all effects.
        Parameters:
        randomOrder - Set true to optimize them in shuffled order.

      • optimizeEta

        public void optimizeEta(int effectIndex)
        Optimize the ith eta.
        Parameters:
        effectIndex - The ith indexed eta to optimize.

      • optimizeEta

        public void optimizeEta(Effect effect)
        Optimize the eta vector corresponding to Effect effect.
        Parameters:
        effect - The Effect to optimize its eta vector for.

      • uninitialize

        public void uninitialize()
        Unsets all data and eta vectors. Releases memory to the garbage collector. After this step, you can add Effect, EffectSet and Feature once again.

      • featureProbability

        public double featureProbability(EffectSet es,
                        Feature feature)
        Returns the probability of feature being generated by the set of effects es, i.e p(feature | es).
        Parameters:
        es - EffectSet generating the feature.
        feature - Feature to be generated.
        Returns:
        the feature probability.

      • incrementFeatureVector

        public void incrementFeatureVector(EffectSet e,
                          FeatureVector fv)
        Increments feature counts by an entire vector.
        Parameters:
        e - EffectSet we are talking about.
        fv - FeatureVector containing the increments (or decrements if negative) that we want to perform.

      • setEta

        public void setEta(Effect eff,
          double[] values)
        Sets the eta vector for a particular Effect. This is usually only done for background effects.
        Parameters:
        eff - Effect of eta vector to update.
        values - Array of values (with same dimension as eta) to set eta to.

      • getEta

        public double[] getEta(Effect eff)
        Get the eta vector associated with Effect eff.
        Parameters:
        eff - Associated eta vector to get.
        Returns:
        the eta vector associated with Effect eff.

      • setFeatureCount

        public void setFeatureCount(EffectSet e,
                   Feature f,
                   double count)
        Set the feature count for a specific EffectSet and Feature.
        Parameters:
        e - EffectSet to set feature count.
        f - Feature to set feature count.
        count - Value to set to.

      • setFeatureVector

        public void setFeatureVector(EffectSet e,
                    FeatureVector fv)
        Set the feature vector for a specific EffectSet.
        Parameters:

        fv - FeatureVector containing new counts.

      • setMaximumOWLQNIterations

        public final void setMaximumOWLQNIterations(int maxOWLQNIters)
        Set the maximum number of iterations that OWLQN will perform.
        Parameters:
        maxOWLQNIters - Maximum number of iterations to perform. Defaults to 10.

      • print

        public void print(PrintWriter pw,
         boolean saveFixedEffects)
        Outputs SAGE eta vectors to PrintWriter ps. Output format is an Effect vector per line of the form effect<TAB>word1:eta1 word2:eta2 ... wordN:etaN.
        Parameters:
        pw - PrintWriter to save eta vector information to.
        saveFixedEffects - Set true to include fixed effects vectors.

      • printLogZ

        public void printLogZ(PrintWriter pw)
        Outputs the normalization constants for each EffectSet. Output format is an EffectSet per line of the form effect1 effect2 ... effectN<TAB>normalization constant
        Parameters:
        pw - PrintWriter to save Z information to.

      • print

        public void print()
        Output SAGE eta vectors to System.out. Slightly more descriptive Effect names than the output to file.
        See Also:
        print(PrintWriter, boolean)
